greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways of pairing odd numbers in the range 1 to n with even numbers in the range n+1 to 2n such that each pair sums to a prime.
example: a(5)=2 because there are two ways: 1+10, 3+8, 6+5 and 1+6, 3+10, 5+8.
xref: The product of this sequence and A071059 gives A070897.
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, May 25 2002
ext: More terms from _David W. Wilson_, May 27 2002
